Name of Place: Dal Lake, Srinagar (Jammu & Kashmir)
Nearest Airport: Sheikh Ul-Alam International Airport, Srinagar (approx. 20 km)
Timings: Open 24 hours (houseboats & shikara rides usually 6:00 AM – 7:00 PM)
Accessibility: Good roads; wheelchair accessible at some ghats; boat rides may not be accessible
Guided Tours: Available (shikara owners, tour operators, English/Hindi/Urdu speaking guides)
Parking: Available near ghats; charges ₹20–₹50 approx.
Nearby Amenities: Houseboats, hotels, restaurants, cafés, markets, restrooms
Special Notes: Famous for floating gardens, lotus flowers, Mughal-era houseboats; key hub of Srinagar tourism.

Name of Place: Gulmarg, Baramulla District (Jammu & Kashmir)
Nearest Airport: Sheikh Ul-Alam International Airport, Srinagar (approx. 50 km)
Timings: Open all year; Gondola timings 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Entry Fee: Entry free; Gondola ride Phase 1 ₹740, Phase 2 ₹950 approx.
Accessibility: Road accessible; wheelchair assistance possible in hotels, not on slopes
Guided Tours: Skiing & trekking guides available in multiple languages
Parking: Public & hotel parking available; charges ₹50–₹100 approx.
Nearby Amenities: Ski rentals, resorts, cafes, ATMs, restrooms
Special Notes: Known as "Meadow of Flowers", one of the world’s highest golf courses, Gondola to Apharwat peak.

Name of Place: Vaishno Devi Temple, Katra (Reasi District, Jammu & Kashmir)
Nearest Railway Station: Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Katra Railway Station (approx. 2 km to base camp)
Nearest Airport: Jammu Airport (approx. 50 km)
Entry Fee: Free (helicopter ride ₹1730 per person approx. one way)
Best Time to Visit: March–October (pleasant weather); Navratri festivals are peak season
Accessibility: 13 km trek; ponies, palanquins, battery cars, helicopter service available; not fully wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Shrine Board provides assistance; local guides available
Parking: Large parking near base camp; free & paid options
Nearby Amenities: Hotels, dharamshalas, food courts, medical aid, restrooms
Special Notes: One of India’s most visited shrines, dedicated to Goddess Durga; spiritual & trekking destination.

Name of Place: Sonamarg, Ganderbal District (Jammu & Kashmir)
Nearest Airport: Sheikh Ul-Alam International Airport, Srinagar (approx. 100 km)
Timings: Open all year (best in summer & snow season)
Entry Fee: Free (activities like pony rides, rafting extra)
Accessibility: Road accessible; snow may block access in peak winter; not fully wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Available for trekking, fishing, river rafting
Parking: Roadside parking available; charges ₹30–₹50 approx.
Nearby Amenities: Resorts, guest houses, local eateries, tea stalls
Special Notes: Known as "Meadow of Gold", starting point for Amarnath Yatra & popular trekking routes.

Name of Place: Pahalgam, Anantnag District (Jammu & Kashmir)
Nearest Airport: Sheikh Ul-Alam International Airport, Srinagar (approx. 90 km)
Entry Fee: Free (activities like river rafting, horse riding chargeable)
Accessibility: Road accessible; trekking trails; not fully wheelchair-friendly
Parking: Paid parking available; ₹50–₹100 approx.
Nearby Amenities: Resorts, hotels, restaurants, camping gear shops
Special Notes: Gateway to Amarnath Yatra; Lidder River, Betaab Valley, and Aru Valley nearby.

Name of Place: Amarnath Cave Temple, Anantnag District (Jammu & Kashmir)
Nearest Railway Station: Anantnag Railway Station (approx. 70 km to base camp)
Nearest Bus Stand: Pahalgam Bus Stand (approx. 45 km to base camp)
Nearest Airport: Sheikh Ul-Alam International Airport, Srinagar (approx. 90 km)
Accessibility: 46 km trek (Pahalgam route) or 14 km trek (Baltal route); ponies, palkis, helicopters available; not wheelchair accessible
Guided Tours: Shrine Board arranges facilities; local guides available
Parking: Available at base camps (Baltal & Pahalgam); charges not documented
Nearby Amenities: Langars (community kitchens), tents, medical camps, shops during Yatra
Special Notes: Famous for naturally forming ice Shiva Lingam; highly sacred pilgrimage.

Name of Place: Shankaracharya Temple, Srinagar (Jammu & Kashmir)
Nearest Airport: Sheikh Ul-Alam International Airport, Srinagar (approx. 20 km)
Accessibility: 243 steps climb; not wheelchair accessible
Parking: At temple base; free parking
Nearby Amenities: Tea stalls, small shops, restrooms at base
Special Notes: Located on Shankaracharya Hill overlooking Dal Lake; dedicated to Lord Shiva; historical and spiritual site.

Name of Place: Nishat Bagh (Mughal Garden), Srinagar (Jammu & Kashmir)
Nearest Airport: Sheikh Ul-Alam International Airport, Srinagar (approx. 22 km)
Accessibility: Wheelchair accessible on main paths
Parking: Available outside garden; ₹20–₹50 approx.
Nearby Amenities: Tea stalls, local shops, hotels, restrooms
Special Notes: Built by Mughal governor Asif Khan in 1633; known as "Garden of Bliss"; second largest Mughal Garden in Kashmir.

Name of Place: Leh Palace, Leh (Ladakh, Jammu & Kashmir UT)
Nearest Railway Station: Jammu Tawi Railway Station (approx. 700 km; no direct railway in Leh)
Nearest Airport: Kushok Bakula Rimpochee Airport, Leh (approx. 3 km)
Accessibility: Road accessible; steep climb; not wheelchair friendly
Guided Tours: Guides available; Archaeological Survey of India maintains site
Parking: Limited parking nearby; charges not documented
Nearby Amenities: Hotels, cafes, shops, monasteries
Special Notes: 17th-century palace built by King Sengge Namgyal; resembles Potala Palace (Lhasa).

Name of Place: Pangong Lake, Leh District (Ladakh, Jammu & Kashmir UT)
Nearest Railway Station: Jammu Tawi Railway Station (approx. 730 km; no direct rail)
Nearest Airport: Kushok Bakula Rimpochee Airport, Leh (approx. 170 km)
Entry Fee: Inner Line Permit required (~₹400 per person + ₹20 environment fee)
Accessibility: Accessible via Leh–Manali Highway or Leh–Chang La Pass; roads challenging in winter; not wheelchair-friendly
Parking: Available near lake camps; charges vary
Nearby Amenities: Camps, tented stays, small eateries
Special Notes: Famous for turquoise waters, Bollywood film 3 Idiots; stretches from India to China.

Name of Place: Betaab Valley, Pahalgam (Anantnag District, Jammu & Kashmir)
Nearest Airport: Sheikh Ul-Alam International Airport, Srinagar (approx. 95 km)
Accessibility: Road accessible; not fully wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Local guides available for trekking & sightseeing
Parking: Available near valley entrance; ₹50 approx.
Nearby Amenities: Small eateries, tea stalls, photography points
Special Notes: Named after Bollywood movie Betaab (1983); scenic valley with Lidder River, pine forests.

Name of Place: Aru Valley, Pahalgam (Anantnag District, Jammu & Kashmir)
Nearest Airport: Sheikh Ul-Alam International Airport, Srinagar (approx. 100 km)
Accessibility: Road accessible; trekking required for interior routes; not wheelchair-friendly
Parking: Available at entrance; charges not documented
Nearby Amenities: Guest houses, tea stalls, camping areas
Special Notes: Base camp for Kolahoi Glacier & Tarsar-Marsar treks; less crowded alternative to Pahalgam.

Name of Place: Shalimar Bagh (Mughal Garden), Srinagar (Jammu & Kashmir)
Nearest Airport: Sheikh Ul-Alam International Airport, Srinagar (approx. 25 km)
Accessibility: Wheelchair accessible on main pathways
Parking: Available outside; ₹20–₹50 approx.
Nearby Amenities: Tea stalls, local food shops, restrooms
Special Notes: Built by Mughal Emperor Jahangir in 1619; known as "Abode of Love"; part of UNESCO tentative list of Mughal Gardens.

Name of Place: Dachigam National Park, Srinagar (Jammu & Kashmir)
Nearest Airport: Sheikh Ul-Alam International Airport, Srinagar (approx. 35 km)
Accessibility: Road accessible; trekking paths inside; not fully wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Forest guides available for safaris and trekking
Parking: Available at entry; ₹30 approx.
Nearby Amenities: Eco-huts, tea stalls, guest houses nearby
Special Notes: Known for Hangul (Kashmir stag), Himalayan black bear, and diverse bird species.

Name of Place: Kargil War Memorial, Dras (Kargil District, Ladakh UT)
Nearest Airport: Kushok Bakula Rimpochee Airport, Leh (approx. 160 km)
Accessibility: Road accessible via Srinagar–Leh Highway; wheelchair accessible at main memorial site
Parking: Large free parking available
Nearby Amenities: Tea stalls, small restaurants, army canteen nearby
Special Notes: Built in memory of soldiers who sacrificed their lives in 1999 Kargil War; houses gallery, Amar Jawan Jyoti, and war artifacts.

Name of Place: Hemis Monastery, Leh District (Ladakh, Jammu & Kashmir UT)
Nearest Railway Station: Jammu Tawi Railway Station (approx. 700 km; no direct railway)
Nearest Airport: Kushok Bakula Rimpochee Airport, Leh (approx. 47 km)
Best Time to Visit: June–July (Hemis Festival with mask dances & rituals)
Accessibility: Road accessible; monastery steps not wheelchair-friendly
Parking: Available near monastery; free/nominal charges
Nearby Amenities: Guesthouses, tea stalls, souvenir shops
Special Notes: One of the largest & richest monasteries in Ladakh; houses ancient thangkas, Buddha statues, and scriptures.

Name of Place: Zanskar Valley, Kargil District (Ladakh, Jammu & Kashmir UT)
Nearest Airport: Kushok Bakula Rimpochee Airport, Leh (approx. 460 km)
Timings: Open all year (roads blocked in heavy snow, Nov–May)
Best Time to Visit: June–September (trekking); January–February (Chadar trek on frozen river)
Accessibility: Remote valley; challenging roads; not wheelchair-friendly
Parking: Available in local villages; not organized
Nearby Amenities: Homestays, monasteries, camping sites
Special Notes: Famous for Chadar Trek on frozen Zanskar River; monasteries like Karsha & Phugtal nearby.

Name of Place: Martand Sun Temple, Anantnag District (Jammu & Kashmir)
Nearest Airport: Sheikh Ul-Alam International Airport, Srinagar (approx. 60 km)
Accessibility: Road accessible; uneven ruins not wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Available; Archaeological Survey of India maintains site
Parking: Available near site; charges not documented
Nearby Amenities: Local shops, eateries, restrooms nearby
Special Notes: Built by King Lalitaditya in the 8th century; dedicated to Sun God; one of the most important ancient Hindu temples in Kashmir.

Name of Place: Patnitop, Udhampur District (Jammu & Kashmir)
Nearest Airport: Jammu Airport (approx. 112 km)
Entry Fee: Free (activities like paragliding, cable car, etc. extra)
Accessibility: Road accessible; moderate hill roads; not fully wheelchair-friendly
Parking: Roadside & hotel parking available; charges ₹50 approx.
Nearby Amenities: Resorts, dhabas, cafes, ATMs, restrooms
Special Notes: Known for snow sports, paragliding, and Nathatop viewpoint; part of Jammu region hill stations.

Name of Place: Kupwara Meadows (Bangus Valley), Kupwara District (Jammu & Kashmir)
Nearest Airport: Sheikh Ul-Alam International Airport, Srinagar (approx. 100 km)
Accessibility: Remote area; road accessible but limited public transport; not wheelchair-friendly
Parking: Available near entry villages; charges not documented
Nearby Amenities: Limited guest houses, tea stalls, army camps nearby
Special Notes: Known as one of Kashmir’s untouched valleys; famous for meadows, pine forests, and streams.
